comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Love this! Bradfield's Grand Vision was almost completely pedestrian unfriendly. GoogleMapsStreetView - a little lower than the original photo.

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] I beg to differ! The bridge had two pedestrian walkways, one has since been converted to a bicycle lane, and lets' face it "wheelchair access" was a thing of the future.

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: They didn't get rid of those "wooden trailers", with three doors on each side, until about 1973.   But there was only a few of them,  and they didn't come along very often.

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/mich2009] If one arrived, I always got on it!

comment.author: 86916510@N00
comment._content: I love the lack of road lanes.
